column3: Makes sense and code looks better afterwards.\nutACK f131872653dadafd9af8bec255dfd2bddd75a471
In which case you can remove the redundant initialization from the constructor, no?
I meant to say what @MarcoFalke asked.
Updated. Now including @MarcoFalke and @promag's suggestions. Please re-review :-)
Anyone willing to re-review? @laanwj, would you mind reviewing? :-)\n\nFeels icky to have uninitialized variables laying around :-)

@promag See the pull request description – it was only `editStatus` and `autoCompleter` that were previously neither initialized where defined nor in constructor. The other ones:\n> Also; initialize non-static class members where they are defined in accordance with developer notes.

@promag See the pull request description – it was only `editStatus` and `autoCompleter` that were previously neither initialized where defined nor in constructor. The other ones:\n> Also; initialize non-static class members where they are defined in accordance with developer notes.

`walletModel` is initialized in constructor, why this? Maybe change here to
```cpp
WalletModel* const walletModel;
```
so it only compiles if initialized in constructor.

Same as above
```cpp
const PlatformStyle* const platformStyle;
```
